instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had no power and no light on the MagSafe.
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Magsafe LED now works but <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is only 1V.
Same after <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was replaced.

Power draw on PSU is 0.017 amps.
History unknown, no liquid damage spotted.

The schematic I have is password protected so can't copy/paste/search which makes tracking this hard. I am looking around page 54 (PBus Supply & Battery Charger) but am going in circles.

Any advice appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
1V is usually a short to GND on PPBUS. Also resistance between 17/18 27/28, the usual. 
Green orange light now present? 3v42 even present?
